Accuracy of Solution.description: The correctness of the final answer provided by the agents.

accepted_values.Partial: The solution is partially correct; some elements are accurate, but others are not.
accepted_values.N/A: The task was not completed, so accuracy is not applicable.

Reasoning Traceability.description: The ability to follow the logical steps the agents took to reach the solution.

accepted_values.Full traceability: Every step of the reasoning process is clearly documented and can be followed.
accepted_values.Partial traceability: Most steps are documented, but some gaps in the reasoning process exist.
accepted_values.Minimal traceability: Very few reasoning steps are documented, making traceability difficult.

Time Taken to Reach Solution.description: The amount of time it took for the agents to complete the task.

Compliance with Instructions.description: How well the agents followed the given instructions and constraints.

accepted_values.Full compliance: All instructions and constraints were followed accurately.
accepted_values.Partial compliance: Most instructions were followed, but some were not or were misinterpreted.
accepted_values.Non-compliance: Instructions and constraints were largely ignored or misunderstood.

Solution Uniqueness.description: Whether the solution provided is unique or could easily be found with a simple internet search.

accepted_values.Unique: The solution could not have been found using a simple internet search and is the result of the agents' processing.
accepted_values.Non-unique: The solution is a common one or easily accessible via a quick internet search.
